Googled and found http://www.w3.org/DOM/Test/Documents/DOMTSBuild.html.

The above states, "If you get a out of memory error (very likely if you
build the DOM Level 3 Core tests)". It then recommends "set
ANT_OPTS=-Xmx512M". Request that people share how they solved their "out of
memory" issue.

Humm. This does belong in JUnit ? Perhaps this is a generic Java question ?


  -----Original Message-----
  From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of J.
B. Rainsberger
  Sent: Thursday, January 19, 2006 9:13 PM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [junit] On Requests and Plans


  David Saff wrote:

  > However, if the only way to know the number of lines in this
  > hypothetical data file was to read it, this requirement would force
  > either two passes through the file, or storing the whole file in
  > memory.  Do you think this would be a hangup often in scenarios you've
  > seen?  How did you solve such problems in JUnit 3?

  As far as I can tell from the community, they didn't. (I never
  personally dealt with the problem.) That was one thing they didn't like
  about JUnit: running out of memory when constructing test suites.

  > Thanks for the excellent questions--this is exactly what we were looking
  > for.

  You're welcome.
